page.title: 01MOSSLANDS EAST OF SOUTHPORT
page.content: This is a low lying, flat area less than 10m above sealevel with deep peaty soil criss-crossed by drainage ditches. Cereals and vegetables are widely grown. Field boundaries are ditches. There are several small coverts of deciduous woodland but the area is otherwise exposed to wind with a broad expanse of sky. The Southport-Ormskirk trunk road crosses the S.W. corner with ribbon residential development. Other communities include Pool Hey, Brown Edge, Snape Green and Bescar. The Wigan-Southport railway line crosses the area, with a station at Bescar. The north west corner contains suburban fringe of southport and associated services - the land fill refuse tip, the crematorium and the gas holder, a dominating feature of the skyline visible for many miles.
